title: What's another way of saying 'in my opinion'? - Quora

response.answer_text: My take on the question: I think,… I believe,… I reckon,… I suppose,… According to my opinion, … (personal/professional) From my personal standpoint,… (or angle, perspective, point of view, etc…) My idea (or view) is that,… In my personal (or professional) opinion, I think,… (or believe, reckon, suppose, etc…) According to the statistics,… According to a research study,… According to the experts,… I have heard about it, but am not too familiar with it. However, I like to say,… In my view, the best way to deal with the question (or issue) is,… Drawing upon my professional experiences,… There are two (or many) ways to look at it, and here’s one… In many respects,… In terms of … (costs, risks, management, marketing, strategy, human resource, environmental impact, intellectual property, etc….) The question (or issue) can best be answered in two (or more) ways, and I like to offer my ideas as follows… I like to break your question down to two (more) parts in order to answer it… Your question needs a deeper deliberation (or contemplation), but for a quick one, I like to say… I don’t necessarily agree with the question (or issue), but I like to say this… I can see both merits and demerits in the issue, and here are my views… There are several pros and cons on this issue, and my take is… I am not familiar with the issue (or subject), but I like to offer my two-cents worth… It depends… Given a choice, I will… Let me share my (personal/professional) perspectives… If I were younger (or older), I may look at the question (or issue) this way… It’s not an easy question (or issue) to deal with, but I can offer some quick ideas… Off the record, I like to say this… In today’s context,… In today’s knowledge economy, … Considering the likely controversial aspects of the question (or issue), I like to say this… Let me think aloud (or I like to think aloud) with you on this one… Let me chew over the question (or issue) for a while. However, off-hand (or off the cuff) I can safely say this… Given the power, resources and time, I will deal with the question (or issue) this way… I like ponder over the question (or issue) further, but here are some of my random thoughts… There are many aspects [monetary, people, politics, environment, etc.] to this question (or issue), but let me deal with… Most people may think this way, but I like to offer another perspective (or a different perspective)… In most instances, the question (or issue) can easily be tackled this way… This is the popular view, but I Iike to think (or see) this way… I strongly think (or believe) that the question (or issue) should be presented this way… In my professional opinion, I think the question (or issue) should be rephrased in this way… Before I answer the question or issue, I like to quote [… ]… Let me set a preamble in answering the question (or issue)… Enjoy!

“By my reckoning” sounds pretty sophisticated and I use it a lot. You can use these phrases as well to prevent the redundancy of saying “in my opinion” : My take on this is …My impression is…To my mind…From where I stand…As I see it..In my view…From my point of view…From where I'm sitting…In my estimation…From my standpointFrom my perspectiveAccording to me..I believe that . ..I'm stretching my answer to help the students. If you are writing an academic essay, you can use these alternatives: It seems to me that…I think that…I would argue that…I'm unconvinced that…Making concessions : Of course some / many people argueIt is sometimes argued..Clarifying an opinion: To be more precise..By this I mean…Here I'm referring to ..Hope it helps.
